bibl.title: Letter from the Director-General of Health of Australia to Henry Rose Carter, January 28, 1925

div1.p: The Director will send Carter a copy of the Pan-Pacific Transactions when they are ready.

div1.head: Letter from the Director-General of Health of Australia to Henry Rose Carter, January 28, 1925
div1.opener:
C/MR.
COMMONWEALTH OF AUSTRALIA.
__________
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH.
51 SPRING STREET,
MELBOURNE. 28th January, 1925.
My Dear Dr. Carter,
div1.p:
I hope that you will feel pleased to know that
the photograph you so kindly gave me is now hanging in my
office as an example to the rising generation of the proper
way to carry out public health work.

On my return I made enquiries about the publica-
tion of the Pan-Pacific Transactions and find that these
are still in the course of preparation but that publication
is expected in about three months. As soon as the copies
are available, I shall send you a supply.

I look back with great pleasure to my visit to
Washington and in particular to the occasion on which I
had the opportunity of meeting you.
div1.closer:
Yours sincerely, J W Humpston
Director-General of Health. Surgeon-General H. R. Carter, Retired,
U.S. Public Health Service,
WASHINGTON. U.S.A.
